pt: {sc}indifferent{/sc} {sc}unconcerned{/sc} {sc}incurious{/sc} {sc}aloof{/sc} {sc}detached{/sc} {sc}disinterested{/sc} mean not showing or feeling interest. {sc}indifferent{/sc} implies neutrality of attitude from lack of inclination, preference, or prejudice.
{sc}unconcerned{/sc} suggests a lack of sensitivity or regard for others' needs or troubles.
{sc}incurious{/sc} implies an inability to take a normal interest due to dullness of mind or to self-centeredness.
{sc}aloof{/sc} suggests a cool reserve arising from a sense of superiority or disdain for inferiors or from shyness.
{sc}detached{/sc} implies an objective attitude achieved through absence of prejudice or selfishness.
{sc}disinterested{/sc} implies a circumstantial freedom from concern for personal or especially financial advantage that enables one to judge or advise without bias.

pt.t: judged by a panel of {it}disinterested{/it} observers

shortdef: lacking a normal or usual curiosity : uninterested
